name: ALBUTEROL SULFATE

indications.text: albuterol sulfate syrup indicated relief bronchospasm adults children 2 years age older reversible obstructive airway disease .

contraindications.text: following dosages albuterol sulfate syrup expressed terms albuterol base . usual adults children 14 years age : usual starting adults children 14 years age 2 mg ( 1 teaspoonful ) 4 mg ( 2 teaspoonfuls ) three four times day . children 6 years 14 years age : usual starting children 6 years 14 years age 2 mg ( 1 teaspoonful ) three four times day . children 2 5 years age : dosing children 2 5 years age initiated 0.1 mg/kg body weight three times day . starting exceed 2 mg ( 1 teaspoonful ) three times day . adjustment adults children 14 years age : adults children 14 years age , 4 mg four times day used patient fails respond . favorable response occur 4-mg initial , cautiously increased stepwise maximum 8 mg four times day tolerated . children 6 years 14 years age fail respond initial starting 2 mg four times day : children 6 years 14 years age fail respond initial starting 2 mg four times day , may cautiously increased stepwise , exceed 24 mg/day ( given divided doses ) . children 2 5 years age respond satisfactorily initial : children 2 5 years age respond satisfactorily initial starting , may increased stepwise 0.2 mg/kg body weight three times day , exceed maximum 4 mg ( 2 teaspoonfuls ) given three times day . elderly patients sensitive beta-adrenergic stimulators : initial restricted 2 mg three four times day individually adjusted thereafter .

warningsAndPrecautions: albuterol sulfate syrup , clear , orange-yellow liquid strawberry flavor , contains 2 mg albuterol ( present sulfate ) per 5 ml supplied following containers : 4 fl oz ( 120 ml ) ndc 62135-189-41 16 fl oz ( 473 ml ) ndc 62135-189-47 5 ml unit-dose cup ndc 62135-189-05 20 unit-dose cups 5 ml ndc 62135-189-24 20 ml unit-dose cup ndc 62135-189-20 20 unit dose-cups 20 ml ndc 62135-189-23 dispense contents child-resistant closure ( required ) tight , light-resistant container defined usp/nf . store 20º 25ºc ( 68º 77ºf ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . manufactured : chartwell pharmaceuticals , llc . congers , ny 10920 manufactured : chartwell rx , llc congers , ny 10920 rev 03/2025 l70767
adverseReactions: albuterol sulfate syrup contraindicated patients history hypersensitivity albuterol components .
indications_original: Albuterol Sulfate Syrup is indicated for the relief of bronchospasm in adults and children 2 years of age and older with reversible obstructive airway disease.
contraindications_original:
The following dosages of albuterol sulfate syrup are expressed in terms of albuterol base.
                  
                     Usual Dosage
                  
                  
                     Adults and Children Over 14 Years of Age:
                  
                  The usual starting dosage for adults and children over 14 years of age is 2 mg (1 teaspoonful) or 4 mg (2 teaspoonfuls) three or four times a day.
                  
                  
                     Children Over 6 Years to 14 Years of Age:
                  
                  The usual starting dosage for children over 6 years to 14 years of age is 2 mg (1 teaspoonful) three or four times a day.
                  
                  
                     Children 2 to 5 Years of Age:
                  
                  Dosing in children 2 to 5 years of age should be initiated at 0.1 mg/kg of body weight three times a day. This starting dosage should not exceed 2 mg (1 teaspoonful) three times a day.
                  
                     Dosage Adjustment
                  
                  
                     Adults and Children Over 14 Years of Age:
                  
                  For adults and children over 14 years of age, a dosage above 4 mg four times a day should be used 
 
  only when the patient fails to respond. If a favorable response does not occur with the 4-mg initial dosage, it should be cautiously increased stepwise up to a maximum of 8 mg four times a day as tolerated.

 
                  
                  
                     Children Over 6 Years to 14 Years of Age Who Fail to Respond to the Initial Starting Dosage of 2 mg Four Times a Day:
                  
                  For children over 6 years to 14 years of age who fail to respond to the initial starting dosage of 2 mg four times a day, the dosage may be cautiously increased stepwise, but not to exceed 24 mg/day (given in divided doses).
                  
                  
                     Children 2 to 5 Years of Age Who Do Not Respond Satisfactorily to the Initial Dosage:
                  
                  For children from 2 to 5 years of age who do not respond satisfactorily to the initial starting dosage, the dosage may be increased stepwise to 0.2 mg/kg of body weight three times a day, but not to exceed a maximum of 4 mg (2 teaspoonfuls) given three times a day.
                  
                  
                     Elderly Patients and Those Sensitive to Beta-adrenergic Stimulators:
                  
                  The initial dosage should be restricted to 2 mg three or four times a day and individually adjusted thereafter.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Albuterol Sulfate Syrup, a clear, orange-yellow liquid with a strawberry flavor, contains 2 mg of albuterol (present as the sulfate) per 5 mL and is supplied in the following containers:
                  4 fl oz (120 mL)                                         NDC 62135-189-41
                  16 fl oz (473 mL)                                       NDC 62135-189-47
                  5 mL Unit-Dose Cup                                  NDC 62135-189-05
                  20 Unit-Dose Cups of 5 mL each               NDC 62135-189-24
                  20 mL Unit-Dose Cup                                NDC 62135-189-20
                  20 Unit Dose-Cups of 20 mL each             NDC 62135-189-23
                  Dispense contents with a child-resistant closure (as required) and in a tight, light-resistant container as defined in the USP/NF.
                  Store at 20º to 25ºC (68º to 77ºF) [See USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  Manufactured By:
                  Chartwell Pharmaceuticals, LLC.
                  Congers, NY 10920
                  Manufactured for:
                  Chartwell RX, LLC
                  Congers, NY 10920
                  Rev 03/2025
                  L70767
adverseReactions_original: Albuterol Sulfate Syrup is contraindicated in patients with a history of hypersensitivity to albuterol or any of its components.
